world

Class SimpleObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.SimpleObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleSolid, testColor

    public abstract class SimpleObject
extends java.lang.Object
    A basic square object that holds image, position, and update data to draw a dynamic object on the screen.
    Author:
    Brian Nakayama

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleObject

        public SimpleObject()
        Default constructor. Checks for collisions and passes updates.

      • SimpleObject

        public SimpleObject(int optimization)
        Create a SimpleObject optimized to ignore certain methods. By default the object is NORMAL. If the object doesn't need to update its state before rendering, use NO_UPDATES. If the object doesn't need to collide use NO_COLLIDES.
        Parameters:
        optimization - NO_UPDATES_NO_COLLIDES, NO_UPDATES, NO_COLLIDES, or NORMAL

      • SimpleObject

        public SimpleObject(java.lang.String sprite)
        Create a SimpleObject with a sprite. Note, this is not the efficient way to create an object with a sprite. If the same sprite belongs to all objects of a class it should be loaded statically. If the same Animation belongs to all objects of a class similarly it should be loaded statically and then copied using its getClone method. The following is preferable: 
         
  public class yourClass extends SimpleObject
  {
        static Animation runS = (Animation) ImgUpload.getInstance(f.getParentFile()).getImg(f.getName());
        static Animation walkS = (Animation) ImgUpload.getInstance(f.getParentFile()).getImg(f.getName());
        static Img stand = ImgUpload.getInstance(f.getParentFile()).getImg(f.getName());
        private Img run = runS.getClone();
        private Img walk = walkS.getClone();
  
        public yourClass(){
                this.setImage(stand);
        }
  
        ... Overridden methods here...
  }
        This method exists purely for convenience.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The address of the image.

      • SimpleObject

        public SimpleObject(java.lang.String sprite,
            int optimization)
        Create a SimpleObject optimized to ignore certain methods with a sprite. By default the object is NORMAL. If the object doesn't need to update its state before rendering, use NO_UPDATES. If the object doesn't need to collide use NO_COLLIDES. Note, this is not the efficient way to create an object with a sprite. If the same sprite belongs to all objects of a class it should be loaded statically. If the same Animation belongs to all objects of a class similarly it should be loaded statically and then copied using its getClone method. The following is preferable: 
         
  public class yourClass extends SimpleObject
  {
        File f = ..., g = ..., h = ...;
        static Animation runS = (Animation) ImgUpload.getInstance(f.getParentFile()).getImg(f.getName());
        static Animation walkS = (Animation) ImgUpload.getInstance(g.getParentFile()).getImg(g.getName());
        static Img stand = ImgUpload.getInstance(h.getParentFile()).getImg(h.getName());
        private Img run = runS.getClone();
        private Img walk = walkS.getClone();
  
        public yourClass(){
                this.setImage(stand);
        }
  
        ... Overridden methods here...
  }
        This method exists purely for convenience.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The address of the image.
        optimization - NO_UPDATES_NO_COLLIDES, NO_UPDATES, NO_COLLIDES, or NORMAL

    • Method Detail

      • collision

        public abstract void collision(SimpleObject s)
        Override with behavior for collisions. SimpleObjects can only collide with SimpleSolids, and will overlap when colliding. SimpleSolids can collide with everything, but cannot overlap with other SimpleSolids. If a collision occurs, this method will be called for both objects.
        Parameters:
        s - The object for which the collision has occurred.
        See Also:
        SimpleSolid

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        If the object is set to receive updates each frame, this method will be called before the object is rendered by SimpleWorld.
        See Also:
        SimpleWorld

      • id

        public abstract int id()
        Override with the id of the object. This method is necessary for SimpleWorldFactory, but it is also useful for determining what to do upon a collision.
        Returns:
        The id of the object.
        See Also:
        SimpleWorldFactory

      • getClone

        public SimpleObject getClone(java.lang.String s)
        Override this method if the child object cannot be created with the default constructor. The string can be passed in as a parameter to customize the object creation.
        Parameters:
        s - A string containing information as to how to customize the object.
        Returns:
        The object customized by the String s.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Override this method for objects that need additional information for their construction. This method will be called for extra information when saving objects.
        Returns:
        A String containing additional information about the object.
        See Also:
        SimpleMapIO

      • cancelMove

        public boolean cancelMove()
        Cancel the objects movement. This can be used after calling move to undo the move. The following code demonstrates how it can be used to make a collision with a SimpleSolid and a SimpleObject seem like a SimpleSolid-SimpleSolid collision: 
         
        public class yourClass extends SimpleObject
        {
 
                public void collision(SimpleObject s){
                        switch(s.getID()){ //s must also be a SimpleSolid
                                case 0:
                                //Assuming s was not moving, move back to the place before the collision occurred.
                                cancelMove();
                                break;
                        }
                }
                
                ... Other methods ...
        }
        Returns:
        True iff the move was undone.

      • move

        public boolean move(int x,
           int y,
           boolean relative)
        Move to a pixel coordinate (x,y) or move relatively from the current coordinate (coor_x + x, coor_y + y). When requesting to move further than the boundary of the map, this method will attempt to move the object as much as possible within the boundary.
        Parameters:
        x - New x -coordinate.
        y - New y-coordinate.
        relative - True if the object should move relative to its coordinates: (coor_x + x, coor_y + y).
        Returns:
        True if movement (not necessarily the movement asked for) happens.

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(int off_x,
             int off_y)
        Change the offset at which the image is drawn from the top left corner (position) of the object.
        Parameters:
        off_x - The x offset.
        off_y - The y offset.

      • getOffset

        public int[] getOffset()
        Get the array holding the offset of the image.
        Returns:
        The offset: (off_x, off_y).

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the x coordinate of this object from the left of the screen.
        Returns:
        The x coordinate (in pixels).

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the y coordinate of this object from the top of the screen.
        Returns:
        The y coordinate (in pixels).

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.lang.String sprite)
        Sets the Image to be drawn to the screen. Not the efficient way to do this. See the constructor for SimpleObject for more information.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The address of the new image to draw.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(int argb,
            int width,
            int height)
        Sets a color image to be drawn to the screen. If many objects are using the same ColorImg, then the image should be created statically.
        Parameters:
        argb - The 32 bit color defined by 0xAARRGGBB.
        width - The width of the image.
        height - The height of the image.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(Img i)
        Set the image to be rendered.
        Parameters:
        i - The image object to be rendered.

      • getImage

        public Img getImage()
        Get the image currently being used by the SimpleObject.
        Returns:
        The current image.

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String sound)
        Play a sound. If a sound is played more than once, the sound object should by loaded statically, and then played: 
         
  public class yourClass extends SimpleObject
  {
        File f = ...;
        static Sound beep = SoundUpload.getInstance(f.getParentFile()).getSound(f.getName());
        
        ... Overridden methods here...
        
        public void foo(){
                playSound(beep);
        }
  }
        Parameters:
        sound - The address of the sounds to be played.

      • playSound

        public void playSound(Sound sound)
        Play a sound. For information on how to play a sound statically: playSound.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound object to be played.

      • getSolid

        public SimpleSolid getSolid()
        If this object is a solid, return itself. Else return null.
        Returns:
        null iff this object is not Solid.
